dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 1774 IH: VA Emergency Transportation Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Alford (for himself, Mrs. Rodgers of Washington, Mr. Steube, Mrs. Kim of California, Mr. Rutherford, Mr. Kilmer, and Mr. Neguse) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Veterans' Affairs

form.official-title: To amend title 38, United States Code, to reimburse veterans for the cost of emergency medical transportation to a Federal facility, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the VA Emergency Transportation Act.

section.header: Reimbursement of emergency medical transportation to a Federal facility

subsection.text: Section 1725 of title 38, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in the heading, by striking emergency treatment and inserting emergency services;
by striking the emergency treatment each place it appears and inserting such emergency services;
by striking such treatment each place it appears and inserting such emergency services;
by striking that treatment each place it appears and inserting such emergency services;
by striking the treatment each place it appears and inserting such emergency services;
by striking in a non-Department facility each place it appears;
by striking same treatment and inserting same emergency services;
in subsection (a)(2)(A), by striking health care provider that furnished the treatment and inserting provider that furnished such emergency services;
in subsections (a) through (d), as amended by the preceding paragraphs, by striking emergency treatment each place it appears and inserting emergency services;
in subsection (b)(3)(B), by striking (h)(2)(B) or (h)(2)(C) and inserting (h)(4)(B) or (h)(4)(C);

subparagraph.text: by striking treatment provided and inserting emergency services furnished; and
by striking was provided and inserting was furnished;

paragraph.text: in subsection (g), by striking for emergency treatment and inserting for emergency services; and

subparagraph.text: by redesignating paragraph (1), (2), and (3) as paragraphs (3), (4), and (5), respectively;
in paragraph (3), as redesignated, insert in a non-Department facility after services furnished; and
by inserting before paragraph (3), as redesignated, the following new paragraphs (1) and (2):

paragraph.text: The term emergency services includes emergency treatment and emergency transportation.
The term emergency transportation means transportation of a veteran by ambulance or air ambulance by a non-Department provider—

subparagraph.text: to a facility for emergency treatment; or
from a non-Department facility where such veteran received emergency treatment—

clause.text: to a Department or other Federal facility; and
at a time described in paragraph (3)(C).

paragraph.text: Section 1728(c) of such title is amended by striking 1725(h)(1) and inserting 1725(h).
The table of sections at the beginning of chapter 17 of such title is amended by striking emergency treatment and inserting emergency services.
